Reviews.Title: “Room small small EXTRA SMALL!”
Reviews.Author: fau13
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed because I read a lot of positive reviews on tripadvisor and was expecting much more for what I paid. The room is... SMALL! At least if you book a standard room. There is non space AT ALL even for the luggage, the bathroom is consisting of just a shower and the room is very warm. No view at all and a bit noisy as well. Anyway, the hotel is clean and the location is good for night life and shopping (but 45 minutes by foot from Old town), the staff is kind. Swimming pool and gym are very small as well. I don't recommend it, at this price you can get better.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but location is shady”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeInGreece
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel itself. It is very clean, comfortable, and has a very helpful staff. The restaurant (Bertucci's) is quite good and reasonably priced for this part of Istanbul. The only bad thing to say about the hotel itself is that the room can be too warm (I stayed in March). However, the hotel is in the Taksim district which is full of bars and restaurants. This makes the evenings noisy in the rooms. Add that to all that Taksim is infamous for, and you get a place that is not for those seeking tranquility.

Reviews.Title: “i was there last year & i will be there next month”
Reviews.Author: iskandar m
Reviews.Content: pera tulip hotel is a nice classy boutique hotel, i really loved it. the hotel is very clean very well located ( istiklal street is just 2 mn walk) the breakfast is nice with a selection of cheese, bread , sausages & the turkish simit, nothing very special but u will find several choices. the agents on the front office are really polite & helpful it was a great stay. for me the only negative point was the room, it was very small with no space to moove on it & the bed was 130 cm for 2 adult, so it was a very tiny room . this time a will have my child with me so we booked the twin room & i hope it will be larger & more suitable for us. finally i will say even they have small rooms the hotel is brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “....would definitly stay at Pera Tulip Hotel again”
Reviews.Author: GsKourt
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is at a good and central location. Service is very good. The room was big and had a nice big shower and since it was on the upper level, we had excellent view. The staff were very nice. Breakfast was good. We are happy with our choise and would definitly stay at Pera Tulip Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,Clean,wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: rana z
Reviews.Content: Our trip was actually a business trip.We stayed in Pera Tulip for 4 nights and 5 days!Everything was perfect.Our room was very clean.The staff were very nice specially MURAD! he was our favorite.Very nice and always smiling The location was fantastic but the only problem was the swimming pool!it was really bad i wish that next time this problem will be solved And I'm sure that our next trip to Istanbul we will choose Pera Tulip again

Reviews.Title: “Exelent accomodation at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: Lax1578
Reviews.Content: A very serviceminded staff helped us from the moment we stepped in to the hotel. I liked that they asked us how much we've had payed for the taxi from the airport to be sure that we had gotten a fair price. Some of the staff spoke little or non english but did what they could to try to help us before fetching english-speaking colleagues. The room (standard twin) was big and had a nice big shower. We ordered room service that came quick (although the menu wasn't the best, more options would have been great). Breakfast was all in all good, a big seleccion of cheese. Not the greatest for someone who like me likes to exercise and eat healthy, but being so close to Istikalstreet and all the good restaurants and coffes this was nothing that bothered us. Our room was just above some kind of nightclub so at night there were a lot of loud music, but this we only thought added to the feeling of being in a big city. But I can imagine if you travel with children or suffer from migrane, this would be considered as disturbing. We are happy with our choise and would definitly stay at Pera Tulip again.

Reviews.Title: “small room”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Staff is polite, always at your service. The location of the hotel is ok. Very central for any shopping or touristic visit. The Metro is just a step away. Extremely small rooms. There should be free coffee and tea included in the room. Breakfast is nothing spectacular but really ok. There was also a spa/swimming pool which was a definite plus. They have free wi-fi, working excellent in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, clean and noisy”
Reviews.Author: wildtiger
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights with my husband at this hotel. Great location, clean and very hot water in the shower (although it was snowing and we had freezing temperatures). I loved the fact that it is very close to the tunel station and to shishane metro station and that in 3 mins you can be having coffee/walk/ice cream or visit a modern gallery in Istikhal. Can be really noisy at night (we were woken up by fights, shouting and broken glass and quite loud music from the bars) and it is quite small (especially the bathroom) so, if you are big or have big suitcases avoid it. They are aware of the problem with the noise and they provided us with earplugs when we asked for them. Breakfast was good and the service ok but think that the people at the reception could be a bit more helpful - answered our questions with yes or no. I am not sure if I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Helped make our first visit to Istanbul WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: amsdick
Reviews.Content: Just visited Istanbul with three friends and was surprised to find that Istanbul is such a wonderful city. One of the reasons was the Pera Tulip Hotel. The location could not be better. The staff, the rooms are all reasons that we will never look for another hotel when we return, which i know will be very soon. The breakfast was good and held us up until morning sightseeing was over. The breakfast staff was so nice and accommodating. Have to make note of the breakfast manager, Cuneyt Hazer who was so friendly and efficient and a pleasure to see every morning. The rooms were first-class and always clean. The lighting in the rooms was also very stylish. What else can I say, it was all great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and value!”
Reviews.Author: TdotGal
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was amazing, only a short walk away from Gallota tower and Istikal Street. Small grocery store located next door as well was useful for snacks, water, etc... A lot of nice restaurants within walking distance as well. We also took advantage of the tunel being close by (we would typically walk down to the Golden horn and take the funicular on the way up) We stayed here for 5 days in early December and the free breakfast was a nice surprise! The selection was more or less the same everyday but we felt that it was still good (daily breads, scrambled/hard boiled eggs, cheeses and deli meat, spreads, fruit). Room itself was very modern, clean and of sufficient size (it's not huge by north american standards but decent size). The rating was 4/5 due to a few small concerns: due to the location to the bars, etc.. it was quite noisy some nights as we could hear the rowdy crowds passing by outside. Also, you could hear voices fairly clearly from the hallway inside the rooms. Hopefully they will continue to maintain the quality and cleanliness of this hotel as we would stay here again for sure (you can see a little wear and tear on the shower stall where the grout is starting to stain). Front desk was also helpful with calling a cab to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: sadiecool99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for six nights in early December. The hotel is very central if you want to be in the Beyoglu area. We were 5 minutes walk from the main shopping street and about 15 minutes downhill to the Galata bridge. There are some nice restaurants around. Shishane underground is about two minutes away. There was a shop next door selling water, snacks etc which we used rather than the mini bar. The room was very comfortable and clean. We slept well, however there was some noise from surrounding bars late on Friday and Saturday night. It did not disturb us much. Breakfast was very good and plenty of choice. We also had a sauna and swim most days and I had a massage which was very relaxing. We thought it was a comfortable hotel offering good value for money. Will be returning next year hopefully

Reviews.Title: “Stylish modern hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: Rebeliza
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about his hotel. the decor is modern and very stylish. the rooms are comfortable and have wonderful ammenities. the staff was so friendly and helpful. the sauna and turkish bath was really great too. also wonderful breakfast. the location is great- close to a main street with shopping and restaurants. also close a metro stop as well.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay in Instanbul, Turkey”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfully clean, comfortable and modern hotel. The staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English. The young lady at the front desk, Beatris, was quick, efficient, friendly and very helpful in providing directions. Musart, even helped our driver load and unload our luggage. The room was quite, clean and modern. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to use it again on my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “small and noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: HunyG
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel considering its location very close to Istiklal street and good reviews on tripadvisor and relatively cheaper price. However, the rooms are extremely small and you can hear the music from night clubs and bars which are on both sides of the hotel till early morning. The "superior" rooms are the most "inferior" rooms in the hotel. To reach the bed, one needs to pass through the bathroom. Wash basin is at the entrace of the room (right) and toiled on the left. We could not open our suitcases unless we kept it on the bed as there was no room otherwise. The beds are very uncomfortable. Corridors noisy too. However, the reason for not giving a very poor rating to the hotel is their service. Staff was friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: DCFrequent_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 4 nights in early September. The location is very convenient - a quick walk to Istikal Caddesi and Tunnel. The property is nice and clean and has some modern accents. Breakfast is complimentary and pretty decent, but make sure to get there in time because they'll start cleanning out the area right when it ends (10:30am if I remember correctly). They also offer complimentary Wi-Fi which was a plus. The rooms and hallways are small and tight, but that's typicall of most buildings in Istanbul, particularly in the Pera district. We didn't have any problems with noise, but the hotel does acknowledge that it can get loud at night in the area and offers complmentary ear plugs. The rooms are basic and offers the essentials. Our only complaint is regarding the in-room safe, which is basically useless. It's very small and not attached to anything, so anybody can just carry it away if they were robbing the room (see attached pics). Overall I think the property is a good value for its price point and in a convenient location to set out to and come back from sightseeing. I would say it's a solid 3-star and not a 4-star as they claim. And definitely not a 4-star comparing to the equivalents in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Beyoglu area”
Reviews.Author: WTraveler25
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Pera Tulip. Room was nice, clean and modernly furnished. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Great breakfast buffet with a pianist. Great location, close to Taksim Square, Galata, and tons of great restaurants. To get to the old city, just take the tunel which is a few blocks away or you can walk across the galata bridge. Enjoyed the sauna, turkish bath and the pool. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: lolla23
Reviews.Content: After reading all hotel reviews, I was a bit worried especially that I booked 5 nights. But the minute my mother and I we entered the hotel everything changed. It's very nice a clean 4 star hotel located in a great area, the pera area. It is 2 minutes walk through a busy alley to the famous Istiklal Street, Underground metro station litrally 30 secs walk away (Sishane) connects with all main area, and the Tunel tram station for the Takssim tram and Karakoy tram and a nice supermarket two buildings away. Its location is its true asset. The back streeet is filled with very nice bars, restaurants and pubs to choose from and saturday night gets a bit loud but who cares it's fun and once you close the window, the sound dissapears. We booked a superior room on th third floor which was very convenient for two people. It had clean lenings, confortable beds, wide screen TV, minibar, safe box and a very clean bathroom with shower. The breakfast was very rich, contained boiled eggs, omeletts, jams, fruits, cereals, honey, bread, and cakes in addition to tea aand coffee. The business center in efficient and staff at the reception were very helpful and smiling. It's a great 4 star hotel in each aspect you will feel very confortable there. The only draw back is the light in the room, it's a bit insufficient.

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: uppereastsidernyc
Reviews.Content: great location, you are walking distance to anything and everything. Great price with modern clean rooms great service-buffet breakfast is morning is good they serve eggs if you want something hot in the morning. Good to stay as a couple or with a friend but not more than two per room... the rooms are too small for a family. The turkish baths were also great after a long day of sight seeing. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: YvetteW617
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to Taksim area, loads of restaurants to choose from, staff was very friendly and always ready to help. Rooms were very modernly furnished, will stay here again when I go back to Istanbul. Highly recommened.

Reviews.Title: “mysteries of website”
Reviews.Author: doclisa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located and walking distance from the exciting iksikal st and the nightlife of Taksim. Very Near the Tunel metro and vernicular. The place is a bit run down and the website suggests views and facilities that are not actually there. The pool on the website is a glamourous thing, not the hole filled with water in the basement with broken lights and water features that it actually is. The views and roof top restaurant suggested is not actually at the hotel, the curbside restaurant is now windowless inside the hotel. Someone did play the grand piano the other morning at breakfast. Staff are friendly and do try. The renovation is now rundown and grubby. needs a clean and to offer something with a view or feeling that one is there in exciting and fabulous Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I like it very much”
Reviews.Author: Alsanousi
Reviews.Content: I wolud recommend it for all friends th hotel loction is exelleant the staff are very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lively area and fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: cj80-uk
Reviews.Content: The Pera Tulip is a great hotel with very helpful, informative and friendly staff who speak great English, Beatics and Kubilay on reception were especially helpful. The hotel is in a great area of Istanbul, surrounded by lively bars, restaurants and clubs - this means you are literally in the heart of most of the night life of Istanbul. As a result some of the rooms can be noisy so if you are planning on early nights (pre 3am ish) a room on the top floors at the back would be a good request, otherwise if you can sleep through anything, like me, or are out a lot then all rooms are great. The Turkish bath, mini pool, bubble pool and sauna where an excellent benefit to have at the base of the hotel and were all really quiet when I used them. The room was lovely, modern, contained everything you needed with a comfy bed and great bathroom. Would certainly recommend this hotel, provided you take note of the noise - although would imagine if you want quiet and early nights this wouldn't be your preffered area to stay in and you may be in the old town etc....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Areej1
Reviews.Content: Pera Tulip is an excellent hotel with perfect location at the end of Istiklal st. Near the tunnel.you can easily reach any of Istanbul attractions by public transportation or even by foot.the hotel itself is very quiet and clean.though I didn't like the breakfast in the hotel,I enjoyed staying in Pera Tulip and definitely advice anyone to stay there

Reviews.Title: “Best in the area”
Reviews.Author: krashtest
Reviews.Content: tI made the mistake of staying in the Sultanamet area of Istanbul on the first part of my trip, in order to be within walking distance of the major sites. However, the Taksim area has a lot more value to offer, and this hotel was well worth the price. Location is great, one block away from the main pedestrian thoroughfare. The hotel itself is fairly modern, flatscreen TVs, coffee maker, iron, etc No problem with cleanliness The staff was polite and helpful. Not superfriendly, but I don't need a new best friend The amenities may have been the best part. Clean gym, great pool and jacuzzi, and a sauna too. Overall, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PrincessQ
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one-week stay at this lovely hotel. We had two rooms on the fourth floor, one of which overlooked a very busy street. People partied late on the weekends, but that is part of the charm of Istanbul. We had no trouble sleeping, which could be due to the fact that we were absolutely exhausted every night! The hotel is within short walking distance of the metro, buses, taxis, nostalgic tram, Istiklal street, Galata tower, Taksim square, grocery stores, pharmacies...it really canâ€™t be beat for location. The rooms are beautifully decorated in rich aqua and brown tones with modern facilities; just what you need to help you relax after a busy day of sightseeing. They were probably the cleanest rooms weâ€™ve ever stayed in. They are probably also the smallest rooms; my daughter said it was like staying in a dollhouse! However, after the first day, you get used to navigating the space and they manage to fit everything in quite nicely and compactly. There was a mini bar, flat screen TV, hair dryer and an iron and board available upon request. There were tea and coffee making facilities, but they werenâ€™t complimentary, which is the only negative comment we had. A special mention goes to the staff (housekeeping, reception, dining room); all were friendly, helpful and very professional. Breakfast was delicious, with a great selection of cheese which other reviewers have mentioned, and we enjoyed the live piano music available on some of the mornings. We loved the tea (drinking multiple cups and probably driving the waiters crazy with our tea requests, but they were always accommodating!). There was an incident one morning with a rather eccentric guest, and we felt the staff handled it very professionally. We used the pool and the Jacuzzi, again very clean. They also have a well-equipped gym and a sauna. If we ever get the chance to visit this lovely city again, we wonâ€™t think of staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Smallest Room in The World!”
Reviews.Author: Lennonpa
Reviews.Content: Pera Tulip was located very centrally and we could not have been more happier with all the fantastic restaurants, cafes, bars, shops and attractions that were close by. However - The room was unbelievably small ... we had to almost sleep ontop of each other and barely fitted our bags thru the door, not to mention how exposed the toilet was, I mean the wash basin was outside!!! This is suppose to be a 4* hotel and for the obsence amount of money we paid it was not worth it. I know Istanbul is a Mega City and space is limited but the size of this room was the smallest I have ever come across all around the world. The furnishings and bed linen were fine. We had to ring down for fresh towels 3 out of 4 days as the maid never left us anyway! (maybe there was no space?!) and the front desk staff were functional but unfriendly. Shop around before you choose here ...

Reviews.Title: “RecommÄ±ned the hotel”
Reviews.Author: taksimistanbul
Reviews.Content: pera tullip is amazÄ±ng hotel...Ä±t's servÄ±ces are very quicke... Ä± recommend the services Ä±n the bar and technical servÄ±ce...spiecally Erkan and Jenyes in the bar servÄ±ce and the technical servÄ±ces. Ä± thank thÄ±s hotel for thÄ±s hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Silence? --> Choose rooms facing the street”
Reviews.Author: JeJeWe
Reviews.Content: We switched to this hotel for one night (Friday) to get a good nights sleep. Knowing that the area between Istiklal Caddesi and Mesrutiyet Caddesi is one big party zone on Friday and Saturday night, we asked for a quiet room and got a room on 5th floor facing the street. Perfect! The room standard is ok and the hotel is well run. Too few non-smoking rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Double pane the windows!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisaannwalker
Reviews.Content: The hotel is stylish, hip and located in the "fun" district. We stayed in sultanamet for 5 days at the begining of our trip and decided to experience this area on the way home. The reviews mentioned noise so i expected some especially given the location but this was beyond. We came home at midnight and the club below was thumping ( literally). I called the front desk to ask when things shut down, they replied 2:00 am. I stayed awake until 2 patient with an end in site, no such luck. At 2:45 music the same i called again. This was so loud earplugs ( the good wax kind) a scarf wrapped around my head and a pillow could not muffle it. Crazy! By 3:30 things finally quieted enough to sleep. To add insult to injury the hotel began construction work on their mezzanine at 9:00 am sat morning the next day. If you just need a hip staging area to party all night or can sleep through a train wreck this is your spot otherwise unless they double pane those windows i would think twice...

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: lcanzoategui
Reviews.Content: I want you to know that I was very pleased with the outstanding service from the hotel, mainly the front desk in the persons of Kubilay and Beatris. Everytime I needed informations and or help they were very professionals and with good will. Both deserve compliments. Thanking for all, Luiz Cesar Anzoategui, Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Very bad hotel & service”
Reviews.Author: gchiari
Reviews.Content: Smelly bathroom, light not working (many hours without any light, TV, wi-fi or Hot water for all 4 days I spent there). Very bad mannered workers, not helpful at all. Small and not clean room, disco below during weekends (it is impossible to sleep)! Do not go!!!! Pessimo hotel, pessimo servizio, assolutamente insoddisfatta

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: fredericoroberto
Reviews.Content: In probably the most center you can get, Pera Tulip has some very good things if you're travelling alone or in family. More appropriate fpr business than leisure i think, one have free wi-fi in the rooms and business/news channels. food in breakfast is good but could have more fresh fruits.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with great amenities for a steal.”
Reviews.Author: Karinvv
Reviews.Content: Pera Tulip was a great hotel in Istanbul. It's located close to shopping and Taksim Square. It's not far from the main tourist sites (Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia). It was great for us because we wanted to see the sites but not necessarily stay in the most touristy area. Pera Tulip was close to a lot of clubs and bars so we could experience Istanbul's nightlife. The room was comfortable (don't expect a great view, though). The shower was awesome. Breakfast, which is included, was a pretty amazing spread. All of this for a little over $100/ night was what we considered a great value.

Reviews.Title: “The noisiest hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: froggy1972Antibes
Reviews.Content: After requiring a quiet room, we had some clubbing music until 3.00 am, from the bar of the hotel, so unless you wish to join the clubbers run away !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: soft105
Reviews.Content: Very good boutique style hotel in an excellent location and great value for money if booked via the internet. The rooms are fairly small and really just for sleeping in but the fittings are good and my double bed very comfortable. My room had a marble lined double door walk-in shower and a marble washbasin within room itself. There was a big flat screen satellite TV but a lot of the channels were locked out. There was a good breakfast buffet selection which was certainly fine enough for a few days stay. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “VERY CUTE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: iason_82
Reviews.Content: I was suggested to stay in Pera Tulip hotel by friends. It is a very cute & charming hotel in a nice location in Istanbul. I spent 5 wonderful days with my fiancee and I admit that the service & hospitality were the expected one! Breakfast & food generally in the hotel was delicious.The only issue I had was with my bed as I found it a bit small for my size...but it's ok! I would definetely choose again Pera Tulip for my next trip in April and definitely recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely will come back again!!!”
Reviews.Author: rebeccawilling
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Pera Tulip Hotel for 4 nights. It was weekend and the hotel was fully booked , so they have upgraded my room to the 6th floor(without any extra charge) from where you can see Golden Horn view. In the hotel there is Spa center as well. After a tiring day you can have a relaxing massage. The sauna, fitness center and swimming pool is also free of charge. Just one thing.. Don't forget your swimsuits :) All the staff was really helpfull. Thanks for everyone who made our trip the best.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money - Can't Complain!”
Reviews.Author: naRYAN
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my wife for 7 nights, and all I can say is I cant complaint... 1. The hotel offered value for my money. After roaming around Istanbul the whole day, the hotel provided a wonderful place to crash. 2. The breakfast was ok, but me being a vegetarian, there werent much options for me (had to hog on the omelettes/cheese/corn flakes)! We didnt have lunch/dinner in the hotel's restaurant, so dont know the quality of food. 3. There is free wifi (its really fast), which was of great help to research more on our trip. 4. The staff were really helpful, and all our requests were attended to on time. 5. Its located very close to Istiklal street (on the other end though). 6. Even we had the problem with the double bed separating in the middle, but this came only on the last 2 days of our stay and it didnt bother us much. 7. There was no problem with the outside noise on weekend in our room, cos it was facing the back (Room no. 1105). The size of the room was good enough for 2 people, since we were anyway travelling light. 8. We did not check out the fitness center / spa / pool, since we werent in Istanbul for that, so cant comment on it. 9. Also this hotel does not have a currency exchange desk, so the guy at the reception sent us to a Change office on Istiklal street, which was quite far. One tip though, if you are in Istanbul for the first time or mainly for sight-seeing, I would recommend you to stay in Sultanahmet area becos all the sight-seeing things are there. We were spending close to 12-15 liras (one way) for taxi daily to get to Sultanahmet everyday. This hotel is apt if you are more into enjoying the nightlife and shopping at Istiklal street. Lastly, we loved our trip to Istanbul. We were there for our wedding anniversary. Its a wonderful place, really warm people and really good food! Its an experience which you shouldn't miss...

Reviews.Title: “Great location shame about the quality”
Reviews.Author: zzzizzzi
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from this hotel after spending a week there, I am delighted to get back to my own bed. Whilst the hotel has been modernised in a boutique style it certainly does not offer a boutique experience or comfort. Booked a double bedroom and was assigned a zip & link queen bed. So as soon as you got into it, the beds separated in the middle resulting in a v configuration that you had to roll out off every 10 minutes, so not for sleeping let alone anything else! Service on the front desk was good from all staff save one male who gave the impression he was doing you a favour e.g. asked for a Spa pricelist in Turkish Lira two separate times and all was interested in doing was sending me down there to talk to the staff who were not actually in the Spa. Consequently I did not use these services and hey their loss if they do not want my money. On Friday night we were given sleep eyemasks with ear plugs in the afternoon. And yes the hotel and surrounding area was noisy with revellers but that did not bother us given the beds! Also knowing it was a city centre urban hotel. This is not for those who need peace and quiet though. Breakfast was the same for the seven days with no variations whatsoever. The hotel bar is adjoining and a club environment at weekends which on a Saturday at 2300 we could not get access as it was full, so again we took our money elsewhere. This hotel has one thing in its favour - that being its location however, there are lots of hotels in this same location so why not give them a try.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: g_styles123
Reviews.Content: Great location, 2 mins to Istikal ave, you must go there for a walk. 5-10 mins from Galata, walking distance to pretty much anywhere you wanna go if you like to walk. The hotel looks posh. This is a four star hotel. If it was a bit bigger and some surfaces a little better it would make it a 5 star. We stayed here with a kid for 5 nights and she loved swimming in the pool and playing in the jacuzzi. We loved the breakfast, I guess you need to be a bit picky not to like it. Great variety of cheeses, two fountain drinks, tea, coffee, omelette, boiled eggs, etc. enough to get you ready for the day. The staff was nice. The rooms have a nice sized tv, probably 37in. We were facing the front of the hotel and the view of the other buildings on the street made us feel like we're in Italy. Free wi-fi. Don't forget to go shopping on Istikal, we found the prices to be great. The turkish bath and the sauna were great too, don't underestimate the size of the sauna, it gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel with all the turkish delights..”
Reviews.Author: FlyingBlueBoy
Reviews.Content: Tulip Pera was a nice surprise.. the room was actually better in real than in the picture, specially for the jacuzzi in the room.. but that is only a start.. If you want to enjoy a full spa threatment after a day in istanbul, the hotel has got everything you need.. sauna, steam bath & turkish bath.. the personnel is very professional and gentle.. service very good and if after that you have no energy to go out anymore, you can taste room service and enjoy your room... marble, wood and velvet are at touch.. nice decoration with light in the staircase.. when i went there i stayed at the top floor and there was actually a water leakage from the roof, but i'm sure is now well repaired. Enjoy istanbul, rest at the tulip pera.. ! P.s. the hotel is not very big, but the service, including the breakfast let you enjoy turkish food..

Reviews.Title: “OK for 1-2 nights”
Reviews.Author: VeraSvarcova
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good and we can recommend it for 1-2 nights of leisure trip. But we spent in Pera Tulip 6 nights and found it as too much. The rooms are clean but very very small and without space for the luggage so you have to jump over directly from bed to bathroom or to window ... Also in the bath room is no place where to put anything. Only one chair is in double room what is not very comfortable. The breakfast was nothing special, no fresh fruits and without change the whole week - so after some days we had enough of that. The pool and sauna are also very small and what more the pool was mostly out of operation due to maintenance. As mentioned above, the hotel is appropriate for the short tourist stay only.

Reviews.Title: “A bit lacking in substance”
Reviews.Author: Apollo96
Reviews.Content: This hotel should come with a health warning "beware of the bars at the rear of the hotel" We were not expecting perfect silence in Istanbul but having to sleep with ear plugs to try and block out 3am clubs is a bit much. The hotel staff are aware of the issue and were good enough to move us to the front of the hotel for our last night. Other than the noise factor the hotel is in a good location and has good facilities for a hotel of its size. One thing is that the breakfast could be better as it is clear they have cut corners on produce where possible.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and hospitable”
Reviews.Author: psteva
Reviews.Content: Apart from miscommunication regarding airport pick up, our stay at Tulip was comfortable, and the services were excellent, the receptionist staff were very helpful towards our needs. We personally thank Erkan for being so nice and helpful. We will surely recommend this hotel to our families and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Location good, but rooms very small and dark”
Reviews.Author: VitelloTonatto
Reviews.Content: The location is great and you can do lots of walking from the hotel. The design is different and modern with an oriental touch. The rooms were very, very small and looking over a courtyard made our room too dark. I did not like that the glassdoor between the room and the toilett did not shut properly - no privacy here. The breakfastbuffet was nothing spectacular and the staff did not seem interested in being helpful. Nonetheless, we were there with a group of friends and had our fun elsewhere. For the very low prices we paid it was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Pera Tulip: we should like to go back!”
Reviews.Author: martienmaas
Reviews.Content: From 16 september till 20 september we stayed in Pera Tulip. We had one room at the front and one at the backside. The room at the front was big and also the bed was perfect. The room at the backside was small and also the bed. The second day we asked for a room at the front and we got it: the room was bigger but the bed was too small. The rooms looked clean and the service was perfect. The second day our friend got ill and had to go to a hospital. We were helped very good by everyone off the staff. We even got the private telephone number of the manager: we could call him day and night! Our friend was taken to the Germain hospital (5 minutes from the hotel). The last day we were allowed to keep the hotelroom untill 5 o'clock so we could transport our friend to the airport. We have good memories (good hotel; beautifull and busy city; kind people; good saloons and restaurants and so long).

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money !!!”
Reviews.Author: amjadr
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms, one was the superior room while the other one was executive room with a balcony and a beautiful view of the city and Bosphorus. The bathroom was very nice and clean though the tubs were uncomfortably high. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating they even upgraded our room. The standard rooms are small but the executive rooms are quite comfortable. The location is just right if you want to enjoy the night life. as the bars, restaurants and clubs are walking distance. However if you want to enjoy the more cultural and tourist locations Sultanehmet would be a better bet. All in all it is a cute hotel in the heart of Istanbul with a great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Little Boutique Hotel Secret in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LeoLourdes
Reviews.Content: A great little boutique hotel, nesled in vibrant Istanbul. Very well priced and the room we stayed in which was one the larger rooms was very well priced for what we got. They had a nice hammam downstairs although the pool was a little small. The staff at the hammam gave a great scrub/hamman and massage. Also it's in a really cool part of town which is full of lovely cafes, restaurant, art galleries etc. I would defintely go back and recommend for couples not really for families. I found it very romantic and Mandy loved it too. The decor was very dark and mysterious but also modern. They had nice modern design but with traditional elements too. Their reception felt a bit understaffed though as it felt enquiries took a while to get dealt with. Although once we were served the service of reception wre very competent. Also visit Reina which is an open air restaurant and nightclub overlooking the Bosphorus River. Have fun! Wishing you well, Leo Lourdes www.futureminded.co.uk No 10 Harley Street London W1G 9PF

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with good facilities”
Reviews.Author: Sam_and_Charlie
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed here for 5 nights in June, we were on the third floor overlooking a courtyard. The room was very nice and well decorated. The furnishings are very modern and elegant, a downside is that the tea and coffee facilities are chargeable, 3 euros for a cup of tea or coffee. The sauna and Turkish bath were very nice, as was the pool and the jacuzzi. We didn't use the gym, but it seemed well equipped. The only real let down was the Damask restaurant, when we ate in there there was only us and one other man, the food took a long time to come out and although perfectly nice and edible it just did not live up to my expectation and it did not have ottoman cuisine as far as i could tell; the big Konak restaurant in the city centre was very nice. The facilities and the hotel were really lovely, breakfast was very nice and had a good variety to cater to all. Also it is in walking distance of many sites, it is very near the Galata Tower and the river, so there is plenty to do. All in all it was a lovely hotel and I think that it deserves its four star status.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MargandMike
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly. The rooms were very small. They kept having difficulties such as no wifi, no internet, no tv, and the safe didn't work one night. They were slow to fix these problems. The biggest problem however, is that every Friday and Saturday night the hotel becomes an all-night disco, so it is impossible to sleep here. The location is great. The hotel has no tourist info, not even a map of the local area.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BigSoftie123
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have mentioned, the rooms at this hotel are very small, and the only furniture has the air of cheap flat-pack (desk/wardrobe). However, the tiny bathrooms are modern and well decorated, and it's unlikely you'd want to spend too much time in your hotel whilst in Istanbul anyway. The pool area was understaffed at times so it got a little untidy and meant getting your own towels (no hardship, but still...). The enitre hotel is poorly lit in a deliberate way that is meant to be chic, but I wouldn't have been very happy about this if I had any sight/mobility problems. The breakfast terrace area is lovely and is a taste of what is essentially the best thing about the hotel - the location. Beyoglu is full of lovely little winding streets and alleyways that at night are home to laid back bars and restaurants that feel so much less touristy than those in the Sultanahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “worths the money”
Reviews.Author: tripper-pi
Reviews.Content: i was at pera tulip for almost a week with a friend of mine. location of the hotel was a gift for us as we were addicted to Istiklal St. not to mention Metro station and Taqsim Sq. was so near to the hotel. the interior designer had a good taste; thou' small room, bathroom, lobby but all beautifully designed. nice and polite staff. thin walls, good for eavesdropping. delicious diverse breakfasts. tranquilizing lighting in passages and rooms. if i could make it one more time to Istanbul, i would choose pera tulip to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay in it again”
Reviews.Author: Fatima_Akbar
Reviews.Content: good location, friendly staff, nice breakfast, clean rooms but really tight and small ones. the location of the hotel was very good, only 5 mins walk to the main road 'istiklal road' and 3 mins walk to Sichane Metro. the only thing that i didnt like in the hotel is the bathroom smell, otherwise i do recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: jillmet
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was awesome! I know it seems a bit excessive to rate everything as excellent but it was! It really made the stay in Istanbul that much more! It is on a quieter road just off the busy Istikal St. which is packed with shops and restaurants. Also it is a close walk to many back streets which have great cafes and restaurants. Definately wander through here and find something delicious! It is in a fantastic location, it's clean, modern, well priced, safe and comfortable. The rooms are smaller than the typical North American room but it is well laid out and is very comfortable. The bathroom is wonderful- marble shower and beautiful sink area. The beds are very comforable and nice crisp clean white sheets. The lighting is very cool in the room. There is AC and lots of channels on the TV. The entire hotel has a funky modern/ Turkish vibe to it. The turkish bath and pool in the basement is a must! Several of my friends also stayed at this hotel and we all thoroughly enjoyed the turkish bath. It's much cheaper than going to one of the tourist ones and you get a much better scrub and massage! Definately go get a bath! And the breakfast in the morning is great. Fruit, yogurt, pastries, eggs etc. You can eat on the back terrace which is one a quiet back street- just a lovely way to start the day! I have previously been to Istanbul but stayed in Sultanahmet. After staying in the Taksim area, I realize what a mistake staying in Sultanahmet was. Our hotel in Sultanahmet was much more expensive and we got much less (a sub par breakfast and yucky room!) Not only will you be constantly be bothered to buy everything and go to every restaurant- everything is at least double the price because it is tourist central. Sultanahmet is beautiful and has lots of sights and is well worth spending lots of time there. But I would highly suggest staying and eating near Taksim. Food is better and prices are much much much less! So, all in all. The Pera Tulip is definately a place to stay! I can't say enough great stuff about this hotel. If it's full, check out Tulip City which is a few doors down (had some friends stay here and they loved it!) and I think just as reasonably priced! Thank you Pera Tulip Staff for maintaining such a great hotel which truly made my stay in Istanbul much more enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: shanali073
Reviews.Content: friendly hotel and good service. the size of rooms are great. and location is town center.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, trendy - but tight rooms!”
Reviews.Author: adelly
Reviews.Content: Location - apparently in the trendy Beyoglu district. Still, we had a hard time looking for really trendy bars. It's near this main strip where a lot of restaurants and bars were located, but these places seemed more touristy, not really hip. Rooms - modern furnishing and decor, which we love. However, very tiny rooms! I thought our room was already tiny, but upon looking at photos from other travelers, I guess we were lucky already! What sucked though, was the location of our room, which was an internal one. I guess that's the price you have to pay for paying so cheap. I think it faced a wall. Amenities - nice spa. Women should be careful about the hamam, though. I booked one, not knowing well what a Turkish bath entailed and that the masseuse was a young man. I think I may have gotten more than I bargained for there. Breakfast - OMG. Absolutely awesome! Forces you to wake up early, just to get to the spread. Various continental and middle eastern cuisine at their buffet area. Don't miss this! Price - quite reasonable, especially since we booked with Expedia. Maybe spring a few extra bucks for a room that actually has a view of something other than a wall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice city hotel with good service.”
Reviews.Author: paulandtoby
Reviews.Content: Well-situated near the pedestrian mall. (in the newer part of Istanbul). Attentive staff. Small, but clean and funky rooms. All the amenities. Breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, avoid definitely the first floor !!”
Reviews.Author: fotsam
Reviews.Content: The room they gave us was at first floor above the restaurant...First of all it was extremely small and the heat ventilator was out of order..We informed the reception about the problem and after 30min they sent us a "technician" who didh't speak english to fix it!! He didh't!But this was not the major problem....The major problem was the music and the noise from the restaurant below until 3am....Breakfast was mediocre for a 4star hotel and the staff was ok..near taksim square and metro station but not very easy to find...

Reviews.Title: “Modern Chic Hotel with Hints of Turkish Tradition”
Reviews.Author: MomentNow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pera Tulip at the beginning of our Turkish trip. The hotel wasn't the most easy to find to start with but as soon as you settle in you'll realise that it is actually very close to everything the new town of Istanbul offers. It's only about a 5 minute walk to the main shopping street, or less than 10 mins of walking to the southern tunnel leading to the bridge. Bear in mind that the "Superior" room is actually their standard room and the sizes can be quite small depending on which room you get. We got the room which was literally the size of a double bed plus a table. So we complained and much to our surprise we were upgraded to an Executive Balcony Room, which was very good.

Reviews.Title: “it was everything we expected!”
Reviews.Author: shaggoo
Reviews.Content: OK, so there have been some mixed opinions about Pera Tulip Hotel. We booked our holiday way in advance when the reviews were only good ones, so we were a bit nervous when we arrived in Istanbul. We went for 3 nights (5-8 May). We did not want to stay around the Sultanahmet area because we liked the nightlife which BeyoÄŸlu had to offer. We also knew that we would be out and about all day so we wanted a room only for sleeping. The location for us was therefore ideal. It was only 3-4 min walk to the lower end of Istiklal Caddesi. It took 15-20mins to walk up Istiklal Caddesi to Taksim (we never took the tram because it was always full). In the other direction, it took about the same time to walk down the steep hill to Galata bridge and over to Sultanahmet. The tunel station was only 3 min walk away from the hotel - ideal to avoid walking up the hill back to the hotel from Galata bridge (only 1 TL with an Abkil). The lower station is to the left when you come off Galata bridge. At night, there is an abundance of restaurants and bars very local to the restaurant and off the side roads of Istiklal Caddesi, all ranging in price to suit everyone. Quite important for us - this area serves alchohol more widely and publicly unlike Sultanahmet. Istiklal Caddesi starts to wind down from 11pm onwards as tired locals and tourists start thinning out. We also found that Istiklal Caddesi was generally more populated towards Taksim. Anyway, back to Pera Tulip. We travelled very light (one small pack back each) and we landed at Sabiha GÃ¶kÃ§en Airport and caught the Havas bus which was waiting outside (they come and go every half hour direct to Taksim (13TL). It took 1 hour to get to Taksim from where we walked down Istiklal Caddesi. We turned right (past tunel station) and found Pera Tulip on a quietish road next door to the Bristol Hotel. We arrived at 4pm Wednesday where we were greeted with a smile. I was quick to ask for a room at the front (did not want to chance a back room over the restaurant). Everything went according to how it should. We were shown to the 3rd floor. My expectation of the room (standard, not executive) was that it would be small. I was right so not disappointed. My first impressions of the room was that it was decorated and furnished to a very good standard. It was clean, comfortable and everything was fully functioning. If anything, it had more to offer than what we really needed considering that we only booked it for the location/price/somewhere to sleep! So far, so good! Our first minor problem was the safe. We could not lock it because it kept coming up with a "Motor Error" message. 2 maintance men came up 2 mins after a quick call to reception. They couldn't fix it so said that they would have to call up the manager. Whilst waiting for him, I tried the safe again. I kept the door shut tight and then punched the code on the door. I heard the 2 metal pins being pushed out by the motor in the door and lock into the side of the safe. Job done! The 2 metal pins couldn't clear the side of the safe unless the door was held tightly shut. Anyway back to the room. Yes, it is small and therefore compact. But me and my wife were there for our 10th anniversary, so we liked the intimate and cosy feel to it. We had travelled light so we weren't going to be tripped over by our luggage. A couple with 2 large suitcases would struggle for storage. The bed was a bit small for us - sort of inbetween a British king size and single size. It was very comfortable - I'am very critical about hotel beds but we slept liked a log on this! There was a 32" flat screen TV on the wall which was big enough for a room of this size. It had 40 channel of which maybe 5 were English spoken - we stuck to the BBC World Channel. I quite liked the bathroom door near the front door. It was glass but not transparent. Yes, there is a gap (quarter inch) all round but you still have all the privacy. Then there is the toilet and sink. Not much to say about that but my wife said she needed more light to do her makeup. Then there is another glass door which swings open into the walk in shower. The only problem here is that I used to run the shower first to get the water hot but the door would have to be open directly under the shower for me to do this so it would get wet. The walk in shower was big enough for two! We had no problems with the plumbing and the hot water could come out with a great deal of force. Looking at the pictures though, I would say that the design of the rooms vary so be careful. At night, the room overlooking the road was quiet enough for us to sleep with no traffic noise. I can't comment on the noise from the restaurant because we didn't hear anything - even at 12.30am on Saturday on our way back to our room up the staircase. Breakfast is served till 10am, though it seemed to go on till 10.30am on the first floor. The lifts (3) were slow so we always took the stairs. Breakfast is typical of the choice that you would get with nothing really missing or nothing really outstanding. You normally help yourselves to a table and get served tea or coffee. Everything else is self service. Didn't fancy the orange juice which wasn't natural. Also on the 1st floor in an adjacent room are two internet computers. The swimming pool/sauna/gym are in the basement. We paid it a visit to have a look and were very impressed but never got to used the facilities because they close it all at 9.30pm. We had an evening flight back and were told that we could keep the room at a half day rate. We choose to leave our baggage at reception instead. Upon arrival back at the hotel, we handed our ticket to the person in charge of the baggage which he then seemed to have misplaced and then he disappeared! So after 15 mins, reception let us retrieve our own baggage. We hadn't used the mini bar or the snacks in the room (there is a shop/mini supermarket next door which sells everything at a fraction of the price). We hadn't even used the tea and coffee facilities in our room which we were told were free. We never went to the main restaurant on the first floor (oddly enough, we don't even know where it is!). Before leaving, we used the toilets at the back of reception. We paid Â£200 for 3 nights and our lasting impressions of the hotel would be that the decor/materials/craftsmanship was to a high standard and the customer service was above average, though maybe a greater problem during our stay may have tested that. The breakfast was ample and set us up till lunch. The location delivered exactly what we wanted during our stay in Istanbul with the infrastructure close at hand. Based on the selection in this price band, I would say that I had picked the best of the bunch. Would I go again? If I could have the same room at the same price, then yes - definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the first floor!”
Reviews.Author: SVDH
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Pera Tulip on Good Friday at around 4 p.m. Certainly not the last to check in we were given a room at the back on the first floor just above what we thought was only a restaurant. We did hesitate, but accepted the room. What a mistake! When we arrived back after dinner at around midnight our room was literally in the middle of a disco. We lay listening to the drone of the music and then the staff clearing the tables until around 4 a.m. The night manager wouldn't change our room (he said they were full), but did offer us a drink! He admitted to knowing about the problem. The next day we were able to change, but this is not what I would expect from a 4 star hotel. They should not have sold these rooms! The hotel itself is otherwise fine. Small, but cute sauna, hammam and swimming pool, nice breakfast and the location near the Tunel in the Pera district is perfect for eating out at night and also reaching the city in the day time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bvdb51
Reviews.Content: Had a stay with friend at this hotel for 4 nights. We asked for rooms at the front side of the hotel, because the back side is looking at the (noisy) restaurant area. Rooms can be small, so ask for a more larger room. Quality of the rooms is good and they are clean. Breakfast is of a good quality. We had a pleasant stay there. The location is great. A lot of restaurants around the corner. The main shopping area is only a block away and so is the Tunel subway to the city (to the Galata bridge where you can take a street car to Aya Sofia etc).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you get a good deal on the rooms. Average for mid-price hotel.”
Reviews.Author: EalingGirlLondon
Reviews.Content: Great location - check the map before you set off if arriving independently. Ask for a quiet room - ours was overlooking the street and was fine - more noise from the piped music in foyer and stairwell - you'll be sick of the Jack Johnson/Norah Jones style after 48 hours! Nice staff - the doorman is very sweet. Room clean and comfortable with a safe. Good shower but no space to put toiletries in bathroom. Sauna and Hamman are good but lap pool and jacuzzi are cold and a bit smelly (drains!) Massages from male staff are excellent but fairly intimate so be prepared! Breakfast was very 3 star - looks like a lot of (same every day) dishes but not actually much variety or taste. Shame it was that usual 'orange' squash imitation rather than real juice!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grtimness
Reviews.Content: Don't stay in this hotel on a Friday or a Saturday night as the noise from the restaurant next door is unbearable and goes on until after 2am When you complain the hotel say there is nothing they can do about it although on investigation I discovered the restaurant is actually leased from the hotel! This is a 4* Hotel in name only. The rooms are small and badly designed. The sink in the basin in my room did not fit so I was unable to fill the basin with hot water.Once again when I complained nothing was dome about it. There are no lights over or near the bed so I was unable to read properly. I couldn't get the air conditioning system to work and the bed itself was unbelievably uncomfortable. The breakfast was poor and I was actually physically ill one morning from eating the fruit salad. If you are late down there is little choice and the quality of the bread on offer is dire beyond belief. Do not use the mini bar (rip off) or buy water from the hotel (Â£9 for a 1.5l bottle). They even charge for the tea/coffee making ingredients in the room for you to make your own hot drinks. There is a supermarket right next door to the hotel where you can get everything you need. The junior staff are clearly embarrassed by the hotel and help out where they can but the management couldnt really care less and is only interested in extracting as much money as they can from the guests. This place is the pits - if you have booked then cancel if you havn't then avoid this place and stay somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Very good location- nice hammam - but the worst night I've ever had in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: torath
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to istiklal street so it's at the commercial center of city very close to very good restaurants and bars. The staff was polite and the service was very good.The " Hammam" of the hotel is excellent and the personnel working there was very polite. Very good masaz. BUT........... the rooms were extremely small (i haven't seeing a 4 star hotel room smaller than that!!!) if I had a second suitcase there will be no room for it. The worst thing though was that there is a club under the hotel rooms. I return to the room at Friday night and the music was so loud like I was going to sleep in the club!!!!!! no joke about that!!!!! the noise was so loud I couldn't even hear the TV!!!!, worst night ever in a hotel room!!! fortunately I was so tired that when the music volume decrease at 2.00!!!!!!!!!!!!!! pm I slept in no time .....

Reviews.Title: “I was right to return!”
Reviews.Author: MLBguy
Reviews.Content: My second visit to The Pera Tulip was as delightful as my 2008 visit after it had just opened. I cannot understand the other comments in reviews about the accommodations. Each time , I have a standard double which is above average in size for a European style boutique hotel. I always have had a beautiful all marble bathroom with a large separate shower. The linens are luxurious and the decor is quite elegant. As for the staff? they are mostly young, attractive, personable and professional. Ahmet and Beatris were standouts among a great group. The breakfast is perfect with the food that I dream about: eggs, cheese, yogurt, figs, fresh fruit and many breads. By the way, four nights a week Mr. Ilham Gencer plays the piano in the Lounge. He is a charming performer which reminds me of bygone era.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: globaltraveller_8
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice before and found it very good location wise. I booked airport transfer to pick us up on arrival , it didn't turn up . I managed to phone hotel who told me to make my own way there and there would give me return transfer instead, which they did and suited me better as I was leaving at 5.45am. This time the room we had was on the 6th floor and smaller than last time but very clean. The breakfast buffet had moved to the lobby area and was not as good as previous stays but sufficed. It is ideal for istikal cad, and surrounding areas where there is constant activity and lots of places to eat. The staff we met were helpful and friendly and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff, but horrible service”
Reviews.Author: BusTraveller2kPlus
Reviews.Content: Pera Tulip is well located in the Taksim area. The staff are very polite and friendly. However the lights were not working in my room the first night, they resolved it after asking they send a technician, which they were not inclined to do so. The next day same issue, as I left for dinner I asked that it be looked at again. I came back 2 hours later and nothing. I had to wait half an hour for them to fix this, again. In addition the internet went down the first day, and was not working most of the second day.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but nothing extra!”
Reviews.Author: GnR
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a larger group for several days in this hotel. The overall impression is a bit ambiguos. The whole design is very nice, everything looks stylish. But some staff attitude, the tiny and uncomfortable beds and some other things make it less special. Pros: - Good value, we paid little more than 55â‚¬/Night for an executive room - Executive room large enough, but propably less the size of normal rooms in other hotels - Nice rooms, nice interior, nice decor, nice style, nice design - Very good location, one can walk to all the bars and clubs around Taksim square; Tram station very close by - Overall the hotel makes a good impression - Rooms were cleaned adequately daily - Spa area with pool was tiny but clean and quite nice; excellent turkish bath - Good and modestly priced massages in Spa - Nicely equipped small gym - Decent food and nice bar with piano music Cons: - Standard rooms are very small and differ in quality. When entering a standard room one immediately stands in the bathroom - Staff at the reception is friendly but very slow. For check-in and checkout you need lots of patience. At checkout the bill had to be corrected and reviewed several times due to wrong bookings (but these were definetely not on purpose). - Also some staff at the reception tends to ignore requests or wishes and just waits until the guest forgets about it (it took 2 days to get hangers in my room, also when complaining about noise I had to wait for 30 minutes and keep on asking several times before I got an answer) - Staff at the bar/restaurant is neither very professional nor friendly nor fast. Simply coffee took 30 minutes, order of a sandwich to my room, nearly 90 minutes) - As the hotel is in a lively neighboorhead with lots of bars I reckon there will be noise in summer until late - They started renovating at 8am in the room next door every day which was very annoying; as we went out a lot I would have been pleased to sleep until late - If you sleep too long, the reception WILL wake you up in any case to ask you when the room service can finally come in...I think this is very rude behaviour - The so called balcony suites are a major ripoff. Yes the balcony is nice and also they have some view, but they are way more expensive than executive rooms and way smaller...they are really small. Also they sell them for 3 people which is a huge joke, as the room is completely filled with 3 beds...no more space and luggage. - Major minus are the BEDS: horribly small (size and length) and very hard and uncomfortable. Stayed in a Radisson Blu after the trip, incredible how much of a difference a bed makes. - Some minor things that are forgiven in a 4 Star hotel but unnecessary nonetheless such as bathrobes with holes or not perfectly clean bathrooms or towels that look like they have been washed a lot and minor traps and beauty mistakes (cables behind TV look very sleazy, pieces of the wallpaper were hanging loose, on some spots some color was missing). Conclusion: I would recommend this hotel for someone who looks for value for money and some comfort in the forms of a nicely designed hotel and nice spa at a very central location. But you should be able to deal with small rooms/beds, some noise and a nonenthusiastic staff.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't find any fault”
Reviews.Author: mariath
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is an excellent choice in the heart of Istanbul and very good value for money. We had booked via yeego.com two double rooms. When we arrived they had only one double and one twin room in that price category, so they gave us one superior double free upgraded. The free vallet parking service was very helpful. Our car was securely parked during our stay there. Nice choice in breakfast. Just two steps from many bars and restaurants around the corner but the room was very well soundproofed. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rather good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ustus
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good. On the top of the hill, few steps from Galata tower and Istiklal Street (with boutiques, restaurants, caffes). Sultanakhmet district with main attractive places (Blue Mosque, Haya Sofia, Topkapi Palace) is more close than You can think, only 20 minutes walking distance. Dolmabahche Palace is the same time but opposit direction (place worth to visit). We occupied room number 1111. The view from the window was ugly, but it was quite all over the day. Bathroom is very small but clean. Only one negative i a smell of wet stone (everithing in bathroom is made from marbel). Breakfast is good: hot dishes from eggs, yogurt, several kind of cheese, cornflakes etc. There are sauna and turkish bath called hammam in the hotel. All theese feachures plus massage are very useful after long walking trip over the city. Finally, I can not say anything bad (only the smell) and can recommend this hotel for few night stay. Price also is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, uncomfortable room”
Reviews.Author: RichardB76
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, in the new downtown; from the hotel, at few steps were lots of resturants, pubs and bars on small, charming streets. We had the best beer at a patio, even if a summer rain started... To get on the other side of the Bosphorus, in the historical center with the touristic sites (i.e: Haga Sofia) you need like 15 minutes using the funicular (one of the oldest..) and the tram, which is modern and not very expensive. The staff was friendly, the hotel is newly renovated.. Back to the room - one of the the worst which we ever had..small, with one chair only for the desk and the bathroom was baddd..The sink is in the room and on the left you have the toilet with door, of course, and in the righ of the sink you have the shower.. Everything was modern and new..but hey, I like my privacy, even if I am with my wife: A complete batroom with a door would beat the LCD TV screen which you have in the toilet section!

Reviews.Title: “really a bad experience”
Reviews.Author: denizoskay
Reviews.Content: I am a Turkish who has been living in Amsterdam for the last four years. I wanted to celebrate the new year's with friends so I booked this hotel for 5 nights. I followed Tripadvisor for my trips but never had the chance to write-but my experience urged me to start writing..There it goes.. I have been to many small hotels in all around the world but these rooms are extremely small. You cannot possibly stay in these rooms if you are a couple! If you bring one suitcase, then the room is completely full. I (for the first time in my 30 years life) had to ask to change our room. The staff is helpful but the capacity is limited. Therefore we were placed to a relatively bigger room (still not managed to walk around at the same time). I asked them why they had to make the rooms much smaller and found out that in order to get 4 starts you should have at least 80 rooms, so the management decided it would be better if the guests stay in mouse traps even it was a four star! There is a bar/cafÃ© at the back of the hotel and they play very loud music all night long. When I say loud-(again I remind you I am a Turkish at the age of 30-so I am used to sleep late and the noise coming through your window) But the thing is it was so loud that we could not even watch the TV. When we complained about the noise which continued non-stop until 02 am, they said they can only offer another room to spend the night because the bar actually was rented out to a third party by the Hotel and they have no authority of the management. So in the middle of the night, we had to go to another floor (in our pyjamas) to be able to sleep (at least for the rest of the night). On the first floor my mom stayed. There is a very strong scent that takes away all the pleasures of Taksim and Istiklal Street. We had to ask my mom to be placed to another room as well. I never had to see so many rooms of a hotel in one go! So all in all, I would definitely not recommend this hotel-avoid at all cost.s There are many other hotels around the same area-which you could enjoy your stay-or at least sleep properly. Is hould mention that the staff was really helpful, but the management..it was one of my worst stays thanks to themâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “really good for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: maria_c79
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel perfectly located at Beyoglu, really close to Istilkal str. and just steps from metro and tram station. Staff was very friendly and service was more than satisfactory. The rooms are clean and comfortable but not as big as expected and some of them have too much noise at night from a club/bar nearby. Breakfast was good and many services at the spa center were free of charge (hammam - jacuzzi - sauna - pool - gym). All rooms have free wi-fi. Parking is 10' away, so you have to let them know in order to bring your car when you need it but it's free of charge. I really think it's a bargain for the price you pay, I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I heart Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: DyanaV
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic little hotel. Fantastic staff, which is just a reflection of the beautiful people of Istanbul. This hotel is fantastically located, just a few metres to the main strip Istiklal Caddesi which is filled with wonderful places to eat/ drink/ shop. We stayed in a Super double room for five nights. The rooms itself are very tiny, and it was quite noisy as we were on the 2nd floor with bars downstairs in the alleyway, but as they say, when in rome... to get away from the noise we joined the people in the alleyway and discovered what a wondeful nightlife the beyoglu area has to offer... Such great food and places to drink and meet people... The room is tiny though, and when we walked in, we found ourselves standing in the middle of the bathroom? well the sink/ mirror is right in front of you as soon as you walk in, and the toilet is to the left, just before you enter the shower... it is very, very tiny bathroom indeed... But that is the only drawback of the hotel (but don't let that stop you). The turkish are the friendliest people you will meet in your life, and the hotel staff reflected this. The buffet breakfast is wonderful, with so much food on offer, and was definitely the best breakfast we had during our holiday in 5 cities. And the coffee at the hotel is a great kick start to the day. The staff serving breakfast are wonderful hosts, and the reception can answer any question you may have. One tip is to check out backpackerstravel, we used them to pick us up from the airport and also did a one day tour with them of the old city. Definitely worth it, the tour group only had 6 people so was very intimate and the people again are just so friendly. Also the best way to explore the area is to just get lost... we discovered some amazing places ... Check out KarakÃ¶y GÃ¼llÃ¼oÄŸlu for the baklava, it is a bit of a hike from the hotel, but definitely worth it, the best baklava I've had in my life!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: dabdoob
Reviews.Content: Very attractive hotel. Good staff and in a quiet location just off the busy shoping street. Quite a long but pleasant walk from the main Square Taksim. However very close to a metro station.Very good value for money booked through Booking.com

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: CallMeSpaceCowboy
Reviews.Content: A mate & I booked into this hotel for a weekend break in Istanbul. The hotel is modern & tastefully decorated, boutique style. I agree that the room that I stayed in was not exactly large but to be fair to the hotel the fixtures/fittings etc were to a high standard. The location of the hotel is excellent. Smack near the Galata tower and a warren of streets teaming with bars & restaurants. The old city is walkable over the Galata bridge, as well with the plethora of bars/restaurants on & near Nevizade just north of the hotel, just north of Istiklal Cadesi. Taxi from Taksim Sq was 4L for bus links to the airports. To locate exactly where the hotel is, it is next door to Hotel Bristol when you type in the street name in Google maps.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: mbordui
Reviews.Content: I spent six nights in this hotel with a ten years old child. The executive size bedroom was spacious and comfortable. The staff is VERY helpful and friendly. The area is full of nice restaurants, and is very lively, so you might need earplugs if your bedroom windows are on the back streets. It is away from the main tourists attractions, so you are not trapped in a crowd of tourists. The beds are on the hard side and a little small, but I slept very well. Room service is very good, great breakfast buffet. Wonderful swimming pool, Turkish bath, sauna and massage services. To go to main museums, you gain a lot to learn how to use the TÃ¼nnel and the Tram, they work very well and quickly. To come back to the hotel by taxis can be tricky, as the rates go up if it was not arranged by the concierge: unless you know how to negotiate in Turkish...

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DannyDollars
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, great value for money. Rooms are a bit small, boutique!, but forgiven as the location is excellent and the price is good. Spa is nice to cool off at the end of a hot day. Good breakfast, nice sunnny lively room. Staff attentive and reception always very helpful. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel.. decent location”
Reviews.Author: Charu_Akash
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at Pera Tulip in sept. They upgraded us to an executive room so that was great. The rooms are small to say the least but hotels in Europe are small as compared to Asia. The executive room has a balcony which is big and nice to sit if not cold outside. The room is well furnished with a flat screen TV but the airconditioning is weak. As written by other reviewers, the toilet has a glass door which is not entirely private. The breakfast is good with decent spread. The time to Sultanahmed by taxi is 10-15 min and taxis are not cheap plus they are not reliable.. every time i came back, the taxi took another route and bill was very high. For tourists visiting Istanbul for few days, I strongly recommend staying in Sultanahmed. There is a good market and many nice resturants near Pera Tulip.. we tried quite a few and liked them. But you get good resturants everywhere including Sultanahmed.. Good place to stay but quite a distance from the tourist centre. I also did not find the hotel reception staff very responsive and freindly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but....”
Reviews.Author: leslitalinda
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Istanbul at around midnight, the day we arrived I called the hotel to make sure that they did not cancel our reservation (for which I had pay one night in advance) because we were arriving late. They said it was ok, however when we arrived, we found out that in fact they had cancelled our reservation because the hotel had been "overbooked" and we were arriving late. So they put us in a single room but still charged us for a double room. Besides that the staff in the hotel were rude and unhelpful, every complaint or request was a chore and they made you feel like everything was our fault, the fact that they cancelled our reservation, the fact that we got charged for a double when in fact we stayed in a single that first night, the fact that the jacuzzi was not working, everything was a drama. As I said in the title, the location is great but I am sure there are lots of other hotels around the area so don't stay at the Pera Tulip Hotel Leslie

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel in Hip area with polite but poor service, causing serious discomfort”
Reviews.Author: mitzitant
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in this Hotel for 4 nights and have a generally good impression. The good points about the Hotel is its central location right in the heart of the most recent "in-area" of TÃ¼nel and its tasteful modern stylish ambience. The spa is also a great plus and helps you to relax after any ambitous sight-seeing programme. Avoid rooms on higher levels towards the back side of the building as your sleep can easily be flushed away by nightlife noise - either tr to get a room towards the courtyard or the front street. However, there were serious disappointments: When contacting the Hotel in advance 3 emails and 1 fax which required further information on the Hotel had not been answered AT ALL! The eventual answer after an online booking was an automatic confirmation response which caused serious discomfort: Two out of 4 booked rooms were not available at arrival. One case could be eventually settled. However, another person could not stay in the Hotel and staff did NOT AT ALL assist in finding an adequate place to stay for this person! They simply did not care! The second big disappointment was the size of the standard rooms: I never saw a smaller Hotel (double) room than this! Staff was generally helpful and polite, however not always reliable (appointemnts on massage treatments had been "forgotten" as well as whole bookings (s. above). So if you have a spirit for adventure, can cope with unpleasant "surprises" and if you get along with your roommate under very cosy conditions, it is certainly one of the best places to stay in Beyoglu/TÃ¼nel area in terms of value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: TAP98
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Pera Tulip for four nights in late September 2009. The property is two blocks from the Istiklal Cadisse shopping district and 1-2 blocks from great restaurants and bars. We walked daily to the Old City from the hotel (~20 minutes), although public transport or cabs are possible too. We thought we got a great value for the price (cheaper than most all competitors)---the hotel was very clean, had nice English speaking staff, had a very comfortable bed, and had a very nice breakfast buffet.
