The neighborhood seemed very safe & there was a convenient store two doors down in case you need water, food, etc. We went with their least expensive room type, so the rooms were on the smaller side, but they met expectations and were in-line with the room rate. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag...”
Reviews.Author: charlesanderin
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in good location, though don't expect a taxi driver to find it without a phone number handy. Our front desk service was pleasant during our two night stay, with one exception: needing a 4 AM wake-up call to catch an early flight, the hotel failed to ring the room. Thankfully I set my cell phone alarm. Otherwise, the rooms are very stylish, though our room had serious issues in the bathroom, with peeling wallpaper and poor construction finish throughout, including a very leaky shower. Bit cramped, but should be fine for most travelers. Breakfast was good; dinner downstairs suffered from indifferent service and OK food for the price. I've noticed the range of reviews on here and all are probably correct--it's just the luck of the draw I imagine. A few things here and there and it would have been great; a few more and it would have been a disaster. Hope they work it out.

Reviews.Title: “New, Hip Hotel in the Beyoglu Area”
Reviews.Author: SampleTheCulture
Reviews.Content: We had originally made reservations with the Pera Rose hotel, however when we arrived we were informed they were overbooked and were moving us to their sister hotel, The Pera Tulip, which was down the street. The Pera Tulip surprised us. The hotel was brand new and had a hip and modern feel. The music coming from their Damask restaurant immediately gave us the vibe of a nightclub, only without the thumping dance floor or patrons. The staff had a few people who spoke English and overall they were very nice and helpful. The rooms are small but efficient â€“ equipped with a Flat Screen TV, desk, small closet and a safe. The bed is good size and comfortable. The bathroom is a bit small (hard to find a European bathroom that isnâ€™t), but our only complaint is that the bathroom door is a single sheet of glass; it doesnâ€™t fully cover from floor to ceiling so privacy is compromised. The shower is adjacent to the toilet and with slow shower drainage, sometimes the water would rise over to the bathroom floor. Other than that the room was nice and very clean. Breakfast in their first floor restaurant is included with the room, and the vast spread is similar to the offerings of other hotels in the area (breads, cold cuts, assortments of fresh veggies and fruits, cereal juices, coffee and tea). The restaurant was also very hip and offered a nice outdoor seating area in the back. With how busy it is at breakfast time, it may be a challenge to have your coffee/tea refilled. A computer lab with free internet access is on the second floor. In the basement there is a swimming pool, small hot (luke warm) tub, fitness center and Turkish bath (see pictures for more detail). Location for the Beyoglu Area is great, the hotel is just a few blocks from Istiklal Caddesi, the shopping street equivalent to Chicagoâ€™s Michigan Avenue. Overall it was a great place and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant experience in every sense, possibly excepting small room size”
Reviews.Author: ardentripadv
Reviews.Content: Almost all rooms are really quite small - spec is very high, feels lovely, luxurious, but 2 suitcases in a room is a headache - and the fire plan shows all rooms like this. This minor issue apart - and it is minor - and OMG... Staff are lovely, food is tremendous, the hamam / massage available downstairs was very very good; the price was good for 4-star; and the location is incredible if it's the main shopping drag you're after. Istiklal Caddesi (the key pedestrianised shopping thoroughfare) is just at the top of the hill - and ALL the best restaurants are clustered around it's southern end - walk out of the hotel 20m to the left, taking the second left uphill, and in 50m you're in the very heart of Istanbul. The best place on earth to eat great food and drink on a Friday / Saturday night!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: sarayyynnn
Reviews.Content: Had an extraordinary week here. Staff were great and the hotel was immaculate.it is located in very central point, there are lots of restaurants and bars around. I very much look forward to visiting again. It was the highlight of my holiday.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here every time i visit istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DDSilva
Reviews.Content: wnet for a wedding - 19 of us - great location and rooms. i stayed in a superior room with balcony and sea view, bathroom with jacuzzi. loved it. we all stayed for 4 nights - the hotel made our stay very pleasant. the groom and bride were delighted with the service and the best room in the hotel. fab.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beyond expectation July 2009 - Anwer Sahooly”
Reviews.Author: amanizakaria
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Pera Tulip for 20 days during the period July 21 til August 10, 2009 with my wife and 2 daughters 16 and15 years old. Al though the hotel was full the hotel management secured for us 2 interconected rooms. The rooms were comfortable and very clean. Service was excellent and up to a 4 star hotel and even more. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. check in and check out was faster than any hotel I have been to. before. Servicce was excelllent and breakfast. breakfast was very good and had agood variety of cold, hot dishes and frsh fruits.The area around Pera Tulip was vibrant andcloseto Istiklal street which is the main shopping street. Itwasalso close to the metro,the Tunel and Galata tour (5 minutes walk). I was very impressed with the management skills of Mr.Abdullah Mutlu the front deskmanage who was aleays available for help. I highly recommend Pera Tulip and I will certainly and will certainly stay therewhenever I go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: rimrem
Reviews.Content: Great location. Half a block to a local grocery store, about 5 min walk to the Tunel funnicular. Great restaurants within 2-3 short blocks away, and far enough away from the tourist area. Breakfast was decent, nothing special. Got to see both sized rooms - the lowest priced rooms are tiny - highly recommend going one rate-class up, as it would be much more comfortable. Had a similar issue as another reviewer where the bathroom smelled slightly mouldy - don't believe it is the room, but more from the drain pipes in the showers. Would recommend given its price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, right next to the scene on Sofiyali”
Reviews.Author: david809
Reviews.Content: Location: The location of this place is a bit tricky. The hotel is indeed located at Mesrutiyet Cd No 103, but when you enter this address into Google Maps, the location that is shown is incorrect. Additionally, the location shown on the map on the Pera Tulip website is also incorrect. A few quick facts to hopefully point you to the right location. The hotel is very close to the Tunel funicular stop. It is on Mesrutiyet just north of the intersection with General Yazgan. It is about 200m south of the Pera Palas Hotel. Neighborhood: The hotel is right next to Sofiyali Sk, which was the hippest street that we saw in Istanbul. Many nicer restaurants and bars, tables on the street, people enjoying the night. I wish we had the same kind of outdoor dining and drinking culture in San Francisco! One street over is the main pedestrian drag, Istiklal Cd, which is about 2 km long. A lot of stores on the street, but not very many notable places (Robinson Crusoe is an interesting book store, there is a shop a couple store fronts down that sells Turkish maps and ephemera, I probably missed some gold mines somewhere). Room: We stayed in 1310, which was a fair size (bigger than boutique hotel offerings in, say, New York). Two average sized adults with two average sized suitcases had plenty of space, and the room contained a double bed and a large desk. Efficient use of space, with the entryway containing the sink, mirror, and bathroom counter, toilet and shower off the entryway, bedroom straight ahead. I agree with other reviews that the glass door to the bathroom (which is not flush with the jamb) is not the most private, but not a big deal. AC worked great, flat screen tv did as well. The room did let in a bit of noise from the outside, but not enough to be an issue (and I am a light sleeper). Pool: There is a nice, decent sized indoor pool in the basement of the hotel. The hot tub was not working when we were there (and in fact, there was just some still water hanging out in there, not exactly attractive). The sauna is on the small side. Did not try the hamam services. Breakfast: I really enjoyed breakfast in Turkey, and I think the breakfast at the Pera Tulip is on the upper end. A wide variety of breads, meats, cheeses (some aged options here, whereas we had mostly new / mild cheeses elsewhere), fruits (great apricots in this country!), vegetables, jams, yogurt. All in all, great experience here, we paid TYL 177 per night here, and I thought this was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “The PERFECT boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: evitaagalianou
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful employees, modern and minimalistic decoration, excellent location. With pool and SPA facilities included on the price it was the best value for money!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, really nice hotel style, excellent price”
Reviews.Author: chiaraO
Reviews.Content: the location is perfect: near both to sulthanamet (downhill by foot and/or by tramway + tunnel uphill) and taxim square and surroundings (excellent 4 nightlife, thousands of restaurants opened till late in the night) - very close to galata tower. new building, really looks like how it appears on the internet; just the fitness and spa areas are small (e.g. sauna room for 3 people) and maybe some rooms could be small as well (just ask at reservation time about the size of your room).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Botique Hotel, Reasonably Priced, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: wanderchik
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room with my friend which although made up as a double they split it into twins immediately. The service was truly excellent, room service bringing extra items, reception printing out our flight boarding passes when we emailed them from the business centre, booking an airport taxi for us, storing luggage for the day...we made full use of it. The rooms are not spacious to be honest but are exceptionally decorated with lovely patterns and fabrics - it makes the most of the space and the bathrooms are gorgeous - having large shower heads and with decorative glass tiles/doors and slate flooring all very modern (NOT those pokey white bath tubs with naff showers at all - quite the opposite). Around the hotel corridoors it is noticeably very dark, though I don't mean this in an old stuff way as the lighting is really nice and atmospheric and modern (little purple lights on the stairs) it's just that let's say you couldn't do your make-up in the public bathrooms as it's all deep purple lighting. I personally think it's stunning and adds to the charm of the hotel but it's not 'practical' if this bothers you at all. Breakfast is a huge spread of bread, cheeses, meats, yoghurts, jams, cereals, fruit salad & platter with a smaller cooked section at the end. The coffee is delicious but the orange juice I think powdered (not nice). Although compact & lowly lit the spa and hammam is again stunning with a good sized pool for a small hotel and again the atmosphere superb, I could happily spend a few hours in there. I would definitely return to this hotel and recommend it but you must appreciate it's compact boutique and modern style - if you're after a huge multinational massively light & airy & spacious palace this is not for you and I would not wish it to get a bad review because you chose wrong - it deserves nothing but praise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BelgiumGuestBrussels
Reviews.Content: New and stylish hotel in BeyoglÃ¼, the heart of modern and trendy Istanbul. The hotel is situated in a quiet and safe area near Istiklal Caddesi and close to TÃ¼nel. To me it was the ideal point of departure to discover both, the Taksim area and the old city of Sultanahmet. Nice room, good breakfast, friendly staff. Not cheap but worth its money as you can not compare the comfort of this hotel to the cheaper tourist hotels. Good choice for both, tourists and business man. It is a mistery to me why travel agents only promote the Sultanahmet hotels in their brochures... BeyoglÃ¼ has so much more to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ericaw1977
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at th Pera Tulip hotel. The hotel was GREAT. Location was excellent, close to transportation, restaurants and modern Istanbul. I was glad to not be in Sultanahmet (the touristy area), being here allowed us to explore the real Istanbul, and we still managed to see Old Istanbul no prob. The room was confortable, super clean and stylish. Staff were helpful. Breakfast was AMAZING, offering a wide array of food (including fresh fruit and veggies, the usual eggs and stuff, and yougurt, cheese etc etc ), they had something like 3 to 4 tables filled with food (all this served at their beautiful restaurant). The hotel also has a beautiful spa, so it doesn't get any better than that! (we paid $99 euros for a room). All and all an excellent choice that you won't regret. I suggest you book directly with them and arrange for airport pickup. You can take a regular taxi when you leave (much cheaper).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location, disappointing room & staff”
Reviews.Author: LAPO76
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this hotel and I would not go back... The nice things about this hotel are the location (quite central and located in quite area but next to lots of restaurants and the night life) & the interior of the hotel that is simply stylish and very nicely decorated... What really was disappointing was the room... you could barely walk in there... there's hardly the space for the luggage... you better travel light!!! People complains about London room sizes but I never slept in something that small.... I felt claustrophobic in there! Also... the breakfast was another bad experience... there wasn't enough cutlery for everybody and you had to beg to get some coffee from the waiters... Bad experience in my opinion but maybe it was just the wrong room...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bctravels42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pera Tulip for two nights at the end of a 11-day trip to Istanbul. We had previously stayed at the Hotel Uyan (in Sultanhamet) and after a few days in Cappadocia (Kelebek Suite - fantastic!) finished off our time in Turkey at the Tulip in the Beyoglu area. The location was great, only a block of the main shopping strip and with everything you could need an easy walk away (e.g. shopping, cafes, restaurants). The Tulip is particuarly convenient for restaurants as there were many cool meyhanes in the small, windy streets nearby, which were filled with people both Friday and Saturday nights. It made for great atmosphere. The hotel itself was fine - the decore is well done and the breakfast spread was very good - lots to choose from. Having the option of filter coffee after lots of Nescafe throughout Turkey was very nice. Our only complaint was with the room. It was very small (even by European standards) and not very clean. The most disturbing thing was when we went to take a shower, we found a large clump of hair left on the shower wall - needless to say, it wasn't ours. All that being said, given the good location and very good breakfast, the Tulip was good value for what we paid. We booked the most basic double room and got a good rate online (EUR 99 per night). In fact, the rate when we booked through the hotel's website was originally EUR 110/night but when the rate dropped on one of the travel websites (venere.com), the hotel matched it for us. Had the room been clean, I would have been a much better overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PConnellybkk
Reviews.Content: We purposely choose to stay in this area because we didn't want to be stuck in the Old Town being constantly harrassed by carpet sellers. A short walk from this hotel and you are among great restaurants, cafes and bars and then Istiklal Avenue (the famous walking boulevarde). It is very easy and relatively quick to get to the Old Town via public transport using the famous Tunel Funicular and then the tram. As everyone notes the rooms are very compact and so if you have a lot of luggage you do need to be inventive about storing it to leave enough room to walk around in. We arrived at 7.00am and the hotel allowed us to check-in straight away which was fantastic after our 10 hour overnight flight. Similar to another review the room was hot. We were told by the management that the central a/c system for the hotel had been set to HEAT as it was cold at night and that it could not be adjusted for individual rooms. They did provide us with a very powerful fan. Breakfast was fantastic and over the 5 days we stayed was quite varied. Staff were nice and helpful. Internet in the business lounge was speedy. Staff were friendly and helpful. We used the hotel's transfer service to and from the hotel and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, small , no view”
Reviews.Author: Vkit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pera Tulip hotel, after reading some of the reviews on Trip Adviser. It is located close to the more famous Pera Palace hotel, which is closed, and over shadows the area, making it something of a building site. This is a trendy looking modern hotel, so had lots of good features, although the biggest disappointment was the room size and no views at all. I expected small, after reading the reviews but even for me, I thought the rooms were too small. I'm only just over 5 feet and still I felt cramped, given this was meant to be a 4 star hotel, and I paid a 4 star price, the lack of more spacious rooms, meant this hotel really didn't qualify for 4 stars. Everything else was fine, the staff appeared cold in the first instance, but were in fact very helpful, booking restaurants and explaining how to travel around was, never too much trouble for them. This hotel is tucked away behind the main shopping district in modern Istanbul, it was close to bars, restaurants, and shopping, although this isn't the main reason to come to Istanbul, it was well positioned. Transport to all of the main tourist attractions was easy from this location , without having to stay in the very , in- your- face, heart of the old town, so it was ideal for sight seeing. All in all I think I had an average stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Eminently forgettable hotel used by SmarTours 'Treasures of Turkey' tour”
Reviews.Author: TravelersFromNJ
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel on April 23 and 24 at the beginning of the tour and again on May 3 and 4 at the end of the tour. This is a barely adequate two or three star hotel -- nothing exceptional. It has two tiny elevators that barely hold four persons each. This contributed to "luggage congestion" when the luggage for the 43 people on the tour was delivered. Our room was tiny with little space for luggage. The bathroom sink was actually in our room by the entry door. The remainder of the bathroom appeared to have been designed by an architectural student with no relevant experience. The toilet was behind a transluscent glass door that had at least a half inch of space all around with no jamb or latch. The shower was in a simalr compartment beyond the toilet, This was obviously done to minimize the space required for the bath facilities. The shower was good though. The room was hot and the central A/C was not on so we used the window to try to cool the room. Since there was no breeze, we initially had to keep the door open to provide enough cross ventilation to cool the room somewhat. The dinner on the first night was good as was the wine list . Similarly, the breakfast buffet had nice selections and was good. The location of the hotel was pretty far from the old section of Istanbul where most of the interesting sites (Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosue, Grand Bazaar, Spice market, and others) are located. It is, however, several blocks from a pedestrian-only street with many restaurants and shops. We stayed several extra days in istanbul beyond the end of the tour and taxiied over to the Apricot Hotel for the remainder of our Istanbul stay (see review of the Apricot Hotel).

Reviews.Title: “LIES, lies, lies!”
Reviews.Author: Steli0s
Reviews.Content: We are 4 tourists from Thessaloniki-Greece and we visit Istanbul many times per year. At 18/1/09, we booked via internet 2 double-bed rooms in our names at Hotel Pera Tulip, at Mesrutiyet Cad., Istanbul. We have stayed at this hotel in Sept.2008 again, and at that period, the hotel gave us a spaciÎ¿us double-bed room. So, we booked the SAME type of room for the period 10/4 till 13/4/09. At 10/4, morning, we arrived at the above hotel and we gave to the reception all our necessary documents for the booking. They said to us that "it's ok, your rooms will be ready after 12.00 at midday", so we were forced to spend all our morning at the city and we returned back to the hotel at about 13.00, although we had travelled all night from Greece to Istanbul and it was immediate need for us to have the appropriate rooms. At 13.00, the reception finally gave to us 2 "half" rooms, that means 2 rooms that they were not "double" and they were VERY SMALL and NOT suitable for 2 persons. We were forced to go to another hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for your money - a definite hit!”
Reviews.Author: Diane44
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a four night stay at the Pera Tulip. If you want to stay in the Taxsim/Beyoglu area, it's location is perfect, right near wonderful restaurants like Refik and Leblon, countless bars and cafes and loads of shopping. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel common area/piano bar was very comfortable and tastefully decorated. The sauna, gym, and pool, although small, are a plus to have after a long day on your feet, these are all free for guest use and there is a small, comfortable sitting area as well between the sauna and pool area where you can have tea and watch TV on the nice flat screen they have there. It must also be mentioned that these areas are kept VERY clean, which made it all the more comforting. Although on the smaller side, the room was classic cool with flat screen TV, electronic safe and minibar. Breakfast buffet included, however it's the one thing that could use some improvements, there needs to be some more variants and the breads were hard, seemed almost stale. Off the breakfast room are two PC's free for guest use if you do not use the free wifi throughout the hotel. Overall, highly recommend for a memorable stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea_me
Reviews.Content: My husband and I actually booked to stay at the Pera Rose hotel for 5 nights, which is the sister hotel of the Pera Tulip, just down the street. We arrived at the Pera Rose at approx. 3pm and decided to take a nap after getting up at 4am for our flight from Gatwick. Our nap-idea was short lived however due to the building going on next door...all day and all night...until 4am. After not sleeping for most of the night, we spoke to reception and told them that we would be checking out due to the excessive noise. At this point the night manager very nicely offered us a room at the Pera Tulip for the remaining 4 nights at the same price, which we gladly accepted. We were put up in an executive room on the 6th floor with a balcony with view of the Goldern Horn and blissfully no buidling site next door :-) The room was relatively large, very modern and bright, with a comfy bed (although my husband says it was too short for him). The bathroom was similarly modern but had a few problems. Firstly it smelt quite damp, this was better as our stay went on but was pretty noticeable initally. The bathroom had a large bath, however the shower had basically no water pressure, which meant we mostly had bathes. This didn't bother us so much as we were in Istanbul on holiday however if I stayed here for business and needed a quick shower I wouldn't be so happy! In addition, the bathroom doesn't have a proper door, just a glass partition-type door. Again this didn't bother us but just make sure you're prepared to get to know your travel partner well. Breakfast and service were both fine. One other slightly odd point was that the hotel does not have an iron! Not a huge problem for us but might be for some people. Location-wise the hotel is perfect, close to so many great restaurants and bars and easy to travel to all the main tourist sites. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at the Pera Tulip but if I were to stay in Istanbul again I would probably consider staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethWallace
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, right near Taksim Square. From Taksim Square, there is a multitude of transport to take one into other part of Istanbul and it's all very cheap. The hotel itself was nice, very modern. However, it was noisy (our room was right beside the elevator), the spa facilities such as steam room and sauna didn't work and everything was very small, including the room. The bathroom was really small. It was clean and we got the room for a decent rate as it was low season, however, I wouldn't pay high season prices for the room we had.

HotelInfo.Name: Pera Tulip Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Mesrutiyet Caddesi No 103 Tepebasi, Istanbul 34430, Turkey
